ext_descriptions.ext_description: A knot_specification is an enumeration of the different types of knot distribution that can be used to implicitly define the knots and multiplicities for a curve or surface.

the form of knots appropriate for a piecewise Bezier curve or surface. If the degree is d, the first knot is 0.0 with multiplicity (d + 1), the subsequent intermediate knots have values separated by 1.0 and are of multiplicity d, the final knot has multiplicity (d + 1);

the form of knots appropriate for a quasi-uniform B-spline curve; the knots are of multiplicity (degree +1) at the ends, of multiplicity 1 elsewhere, and they start with 0.0 and each differs by 1.0 from the preceding knot;
the form of knots appropriate for a uniform B-spline curve; all knots are of multiplicity 1, they start with the value -d, where d is the degree, and each differs by 1.0 from the preceding knot;
A parameter_value is the numerical value of a parameter in a dimensionless parameter space.

ext_description.p: A B_spline_curve is a type of that is a piecewise parametric polynomial or rational curve described in terms of control points and basis functions. The basis functions are defined by their degree and knot values and multiplicities. Depending upon the type these knots may be explicitly, or implicitly defined.
ext_description.note: The full semantics of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object which has an additional derived attribute.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the algebraic degree of the B-spline basis functions for the curve.
the list of control points for the curve.
indication of whether, or not, the curve is closed; it is for information only.
Any instantiation of this entity shall include one of the subtypes or .

ext_description.p: A B_spline_surface is a type of that is a piecewise parametric polynomial or rational surface described in terms of a two dimensional array of control points and basis functions. The basis functions are defined by their degree and knot values and nultiplicities. Depending upon the type these knots may be explicitly, or implicitly defined.
ext_description.note: The full semantics of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object which has an additional derived attributes.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the algebraic degree of the B-spline basis functions for the surface in the first parameter direction.
the algebraic degree of the B-spline basis functions for the surface in the second parameter direction.
the list of list of control points for the surface.
indication of whether, or not, the surface is closed in the first parametric direction; it is for information only.
indication of whether, or not, the surface is closed in the second parametric direction; it is for information only.
Any instantiation of this entity shall include one of the subtypes or .

ext_description.p: A Curve_with_explicit_knots is a type of for which the knot values are explicitly given. This subtype shall be used to represent non-uniform B-spline curves and may be used for other knot types.
ext_description.note: The full semantics of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object which has an additional derived attribute and a constraint to ensure that the specified knot values are compatible with the degree and control points for the curve.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the list of multiplicities for the .
the list of knot values used to define the B-spline basis functions.
The two lists of knot values and knot multiplicities shall have the same length.

ext_description.p: A Curve_with_implicit_knots is a type of for which the knot values are implicitly given. The precise specification of the knots depends upon the value of
ext_description.note: This entity is mapped to one of 3 distinct MIM entities depending upon the value of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the type of configuration for the implicit set of knots and multiplicities. These are described in .

ext_description.p: A Rational_b_spline_curve is a type of and is a piecewise parametric rational curve described in terms of control points, weights and basis functions. This subtype is instantiated with one of the other subtypes of which explicitly or implicitly provide the knot values used to define the basis functions. All weights shall be positive.
ext_description.note: The full semantics and parameterization of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object.

ext_description.p: the list of positive weights to be associated with the control points of the curve.
ext_description.note: If all the weights have value 1.0 the curve is identical to a simple non-rational B-spline curve.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The two lists of weight values and control points shall have the same length.
The weight values shall all be positive.

ext_description.p: A Rational_b_spline_surface is a type of and is a piecewise parametric rational curve described in terms of control points, weights and basis functions. This subtype is instantiated with one of the other subtypes of which explicitly or implicitly provide the knot values used to define the basis functions. All weights shall be positive.
ext_description.note: The full semantics and parameterization of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object.

ext_description.p: the list of positive weights to be associated with the control points of the curve.
ext_description.note: If all the weights have value 1.0 the curve is identical to a simple non-rational B-spline surface.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: The two lists of lists weight values and control points shall have the same lengths.
The weight values shall all be positive.

ext_description.p: A Surface_with_explicit_knots is a type of for which the knot values are explicitly given. This subtype shall be used to represent non-uniform B-spline surfaces and may be used for other knot types.
ext_description.note: The full semantics of this entity are defined in the corresponding MIM object which has an additional derived attribute and a constraint to ensure that the specified knot values are compatible with the degree and control points for the surface.

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the list of multiplicities for the , these are in the first parametric direction for the surface.
the list of knot values used to define the B-spline basis functions in the first parametric direction of the surface.
the list of multiplicities for the , these are in the second parametric direction for the surface.
the list of knot values used to define the B-spline basis functions in the second parametric direction of the surface.
The two lists of knot values and knot multiplicities in the u parameter direction shall have the same length.
The two lists of knot values and knot multiplicities in the v parameter direction shall have the same length.

ext_description.p: A Surface_with_implicit_knots is a type of for which the knot values are implicitly given. The precise specification of the knots depends upon the value of . There are two knot sets for a surface and the precise values depend also on the degree of the surface in each parametric direction.
ext_description.note: This entity is mapped to one of 3 distinct MIM entities depending upon the value of .

ext_descriptions.ext_description: the type of configuration for the implicit sets of knots and multiplicities. These are described in .
The function checks all the weight vaues assigned to a and returns false if any value is negative.
(Input) The for which the weights are to be validated.
The function checks all the weight vaues assigned to a and returns false if any value is negative.
(Input) The for which the weights are to be validated.
